p: In addition, workers in many occupations are at an increased risk for the health consequences of climate change. Those at risk include ( a) outdoor workers who perform tasks in extreme heat; ( b) other workers who are exposed to extremes of temperature or precipitation; ( c) workers exposed to air pollutants, infectious agents, wildfires, and/or extreme weather events; and ( d) workers in specific industries, such as utilities, transportation, health care, emergency response, environmental remediation, construction and demolition, landscaping, agriculture, forestry, and wildlife management ( 56).
